toggle.heading: Here are the best colleges in the U.S.

hero.title: Best National University Rankings
hero.description: Schools in the National Universities category, such as the University of Chicago and Carnegie Mellon University, offer a full range of undergraduate majors, plus master's and doctoral programs. These colleges also are committed to producing groundbreaking research.
hero.subtitle: Here are the best colleges in the U.S.

satAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

actAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

items.blurb: Founded in 1916, Russell Sage College is a private institution. Russell Sage College follows a semester-based academic calendar and its admissions are considered less selective.

A small Christian school, Seattle Pacific University (SPU) offers more than 60 bachelor’s degree programs. Students at SPU can volunteer through the John Perkins Center, participate in about 50 campus clubs, and play Division II sports.

institution.aliasNames: St Catherine University Saint Catherine University

satAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

actAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

items.blurb: Founded in 1905, St. Catherine University is a private institution.

institution.aliasNames: UC Denver University of Colorado Denver

satAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

actAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

items.blurb: University of Colorado Denver offers about 130 areas of study, including top-ranked health and medical graduate programs at the Anschutz Medical Campus. In their free time, CU Denver students can get involved in more than 100 campus organizations, as well as student government, ROTC and volunteer opportunities.

satAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

actAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

items.blurb: Founded in 1964, University of Massachusetts--Boston is a public institution. The school has 34% of its classes with fewer than 20 students, and the student-faculty ratio at University of Massachusetts--Boston is 17:1.

satAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

actAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

items.blurb: Students at University of Massachusetts—Dartmouth can join more than 100 campus clubs and about 10 Greek organizations. UMass Dartmouth also offers opportunities for students to get involved in campus media through a newspaper and a radio station.

The University of Nevada—Reno is located on the western edge of the state on the border between the Great Basin and the Sierra Nevada. Off campus, Nevada students can visit nearby Lake Tahoe, check out the museums and festivals of Reno and drive just a few hours to Sacramento, California, or the San Francisco Bay Area.

institution.aliasNames: UNC University of North Carolina Charlotte

satAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

actAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

items.blurb: Founded in 1946, University of North Carolina--Charlotte is a public institution. The school has 24.7% of its classes with fewer than 20 students, and the student-faculty ratio at University of North Carolina--Charlotte is 20:1.

The main campus of Central Michigan University is located in Mount Pleasant, although it has about 50 other locations across North America. On the main campus, CMU students participate in many annual events and traditions, including Native American Heritage Month, when the school celebrates its relationship with the local Saginaw Chippewa Tribe.

satAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

actAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

items.blurb: Founded in 1843, Clarke University is a private institution. Clarke University follows a semester-based academic calendar and its admissions are considered selective.

utag_data.stitial_fact: During the fall 2015 admission cycle, 79 percent of international graduate applications came from Chinese and Indian nationals.
